profileText: A Representative from Virginia; born near Charlottesville, Albemarle County, Va., March 8, 1868; attended Pantop's Academy, near Charlottesville, Va., and Washington and Lee University, Lexington, Va.; taught at Fishburne Military Academy, Waynesboro, Va., in 1886 and 1887; was graduated from the law department of the University of Virginia at Charlottesville in 1890; was admitted to the bar the same year and commenced practice in Charlottesville; also engaged in agricultural pursuits; served in the State house of delegates 1895-1897; member of the Virginia State Library Board 1904-1913; appointed judge of the eighth judicial circuit in 1913; subsequently elected by the legislature and served from 1913 until his resignation in 1930; elected as a Democrat to the Seventy-second Congress (March 4, 1931-March 3, 1933); was not a candidate for renomination in 1932; resumed the practice of law; died in Ivy Depot, near Charlottesville, June 24, 1937; interment in Riverview Cemetery, Charlottesville, Va.

researchRecord.name: 1922-1934, approximately 10,000 items.
researchRecord.description: The majority of the John Fishburne collection consists of official correspondence regarding house bills in the 72nd Congress, law cases, post offices, air routes & railroads, requests for patronage & appointments, a diary, speeches, some genealogical information, and a few personal items. Among the correspondents are Harry Flood Byrd, Claude Augustus Swanson, James A. Farley, A. Willis Robertson, Huey Pierce Long, Jacob Aaron Garber, 1879-1953, and J. Edgar Hoover.

recordLocation.name: Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library

researchRecord.name: In the Samuel Baker Woods Papers, 1894-1937, approximately 2,000 items.
researchRecord.description: Other authors include John W. Fishburne.

recordLocation.name: Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library

researchRecord.name: In the John Armstrong Chaloner Papers, 1862-1935, approximately 2,000 items.

recordLocation.name: Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library

researchRecord.name: In the Fishburne Family Papers, 1811-1893, 200 items.
researchRecord.description: Correspondence of Judge John W. Fishburne with Harry Flood Byrd, Sr., Howard W. Smith, Carter Glass, Homer Cummings & others.

recordLocation.name: Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library

researchRecord.name: In the Micajah Woods Copybooks, 1876-1893, 2 items.
researchRecord.description: Letterpress copybooks from the firm of Woods and Taylor, 1876-1877, and Woods and Fishburne, 1892-1893, contain correspondence pertinent to cases handled by the firms.

recordLocation.name: Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library
